Summary: First saw three lights in perfect triangle formation on the horizon. Captured two on film, later only one.
trends: There have been 21 other sightings in Queen Creek
There were no other sightings in Queen Creek on or around September 28th 2009
divs: Sighting DetailsI was coming back from the local Wal-Mart and noticed three lights in a perfect triangle formation to the north-east. I originally thought they were planes or helicopters, but eventually pulled off to the side of the road to get a better look. The lights were still in a perfect triangle, and seemed to be coming closer at a moderately fast rate (slightly faster than a plane, but noticeable from a distance). The only camera I had with me was a PlayStation Portable camera, and shooting at 1.3 MP, it's not the best. I did, however, capture two of the three lights on film, ending with one light. Shortly after, all lights had disappeared. I had considered not filing a report for the idea that it might not have been a UFO, but after observing a plane minutes later, I knew the behavior exhibited by the triangle did not match the plane's behavior (the triangle had very bright, multicolored, blinking, lights; the plane did not).
